info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 11:08AM EDT until April 16 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
East Fork White River.
Flatrock River near Columbus.
Driftwood River near Edinburgh.
.Major flooding will continue on the East Fork White. The crest on the East Fork was near Columbus this morning and should reach Seymour this evening and Rivervale on Tuesday. The Flatrock near Columbus should crest this afternoon, and the Driftwood at Edinburgh should crest tonight. The next chance for more than a tenth of an inch of rain does not return until Wednesday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Fork White River at Williams.
* WHEN...Until Wednesday, April 16.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flood levels approach a serious level. Evacuations are necessary for those on lowest knolls. Flood waters cover nearly the entire flood plain.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EDT Sunday was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.9 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday, April 16. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 215 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, APRIL 16
